sub_title: M.Sc. Geo-information Science and Earth Observation | GIS Specialist | Geospatial Data Analyst | AI Enthusiast | EASA Certified Drone Pilot | Photogrammetry | SDG Goals
summary:
🌍 GIS Specialist | Deep Learning Enthusiast | Geospatial Trainer

🔗 Portfolio: https://arcg.is/X0jP9 (Copy & Paste into browser if not clickable)

Grounded in Geoinformation Science, I am passionate about harnessing advanced technologies to address geoscientific challenges. I hold a Master of Science degree from ITC-UTwente (2021-2023, Enschede, Netherlands), where I delved deep into cutting-edge geospatial applications, with a special emphasis on Deep Learning techniques.

During my tenure as a GIS Specialist for the Municipality of Guayaquil's Environmental Department, I leveraged GIS, Remote Sensing, and Drone Mapping over four enriching years. My contributions in environmental analysis and cartography played a pivotal role in shaping decisions around Guayaquil's environmental conundrums. Beyond this, I've shared my knowledge as a geospatial trainer, integrating Deep Learning to elevate geospatial analysis and data interpretation. This fusion of AI with traditional methodologies has unlocked deeper and sharper geospatial insights.

Driven by an insatiable curiosity, I continually seek to uncover new facets of geosciences. My profound interest in the myriad applications of GIS propels me to explore the vast potential of intertwining Deep Learning with geospatial tools. I am poised to channel my expertise and innovative spirit into fresh challenges in the realm of geoinformation science.

projects.title: CONTRACT No. S-PSV-029-2020-AJ-CVJ FOR THE "HIRING OF AMBIENT NOISE MONITORING SERVICE AND PREPARATION OF THE STRATEGIC NOISE MAP OF THE CITY OF GUAYAQUIL.
projects.description:
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
To develop the strategic noise map of the city of Guayaquil, which, as a strategic tool, will allow the Autonomous Decentralized Municipal Government of Guayaquil to manage noise pollution control and land planning.

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES

To conduct a diagnosis of the noise levels experienced in the city of Guayaquil, considering various possible situations, and identifying the main sources of these noise levels.
To establish a database on the levels of urban noise pollution in streets, sites, and areas of interest.
To develop sound level maps for daytime and nighttime periods, representing isophonic lines in the range of 50, 50-55, 55-60, 60-65, 65-70, 70-75, 75-80, 80 dB (A).
To define areas of acoustic sensitivity based on the predominant land use, through a noise exposure map.
To develop and report indicators for the control of noise pollution.
To establish the foundations for an Action Plan, in which local rules for the prevention and correction of noise pollution are set.

Budget: USD 78,850.00

projects.title: CONTRACT No. S-PSV-015-2018-AJ-JNS; “SERVICE OF OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND DATA ANALYSIS OF THE G STATION FOR ACTIVE MONITORING OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM 10 AND PM 2.5) LOCATED AT KM 13 ON THE WAY TO THE COAST.
projects.description:
Measure the concentration of particulate matter on the way to the coast, through the management, analysis, and interpretation of data from the PM10 and PM2.5 particulate matter monitoring system.

Establish environmental air quality indicators and indices for the study area during the service execution period.

Determine the degree of compliance with permissible ambient air quality limits in the study area in relation to current national environmental regulations.

Budget: USD 56,400.00

projects.title: Project: Engineering studies in the mining exclusion zones that affect the urban area of Zaruma.
projects.description: Conduct engineering studies in the mining exclusion zones that affect the urban area of Zaruma, delimiting a new alternative for mining exclusion, especially addressing the areas of La Esperanza II and Palacios. This would establish an environment for strengthening the urban and mining development of the Zaruma-Portovelo sector.

projects.title: Hydrogeological Map of the Ecuador at a 1:250,000 scale.
projects.description:
The general objective of this project is to identify the potential of the existing underground resource in Ecuador by creating the hydrogeological map at a 1:250,000 scale.

The specific objectives proposed are:
Spatially locate the large hydrogeological units and graphically present them on a final map at a 1:250,000 scale

profile_positions.description:
Municipality of Guayaquil/Environmental Department
- Produced maps and cartographic products using GIS software and data collection equipment for crucial decision-making of local authorities.
- Managed GIS data for various projects, ensuring accurate environmental and real estate documentation associated with geographical locations.
- Developed cartographic products to aid in management decision-making.
- Collaborated in diverse work and team environments.
- DRONE Mapping/Monitoring for various projects.
- Supervised the Public Contract titled "Operation, Maintenance, and Data Analysis Service of Station 'G'", which involved active monitoring of particulate material (Pm 10 and Pm2.5) located at Km. 13, the road to the coast and the Development of the Strategic Noise Map of Guayaquil, 2020.
- Worked with fellow technicians to evaluate environmental licensing processes in regulatory procedures.
- Assisted, on occasion, with research and reporting for environmental mandates, including environmental impact studies.
- Provided occasional support for assessments related to mining environmental regulatory processes.
- Served as the Substitute Chief for both the Environmental Planning Department and the Natural Resources and Sustainable Development Department.
profile_positions.title: GIS Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Assisted in diverse consulting engineering tasks, including:

- Conducting hydrogeological monitoring of the Manglaralto coastal aquifer.
- Serving as a trainer in Geographic Information Systems, UAV, and GNSS mapping.
- Performing geotechnical assessments of terrain subsidence due to mining activities.
Participated in research conferences at the International Congress in Almaden, Spain, 2017, presenting on the following topics:

- 'Subsidence Analysis due to Mining Activity in Zaruma, Ecuador's Heritage: A Case Study of La Inmaculada School.'
- 'Strategies for Construction and Conditioning of a Waterhole in the Manglaralto Coastal Aquifer for its Protection and Defense.'
- 'Zaruma-Portovelo: Geo-mining Context of Heritage and Diversity for Sustainable Development.'
- 'Tourist-Mining Potential of the Gold Route, Ecuador.'
profile_positions.title: Research Technician

profile_positions.description:
Your description provides a detailed overview of your responsibilities and experiences as a Research Technician at CIPAT-ESPOL. For LinkedIn, it's essential to be concise while effectively communicating your roles and achievements. Here's a slightly refined version for LinkedIn:

Research Technician - CIPAT-ESPOL

Engaged as a technical contributor in various consultancy engineering projects for both public and private sectors:

'Technical study for blockages in estuaries palanqueado and puerto lisa': Supervised drilling sampling and analyzed results from physical-chemical tests of infill material.

'Expansion of Las Iguanas sanitary landfill': Assisted in geotechnical exploration, drilling core logging, field geophysics, and geotechnical analysis using specialized software.

'UNESCO ECU/7/005: Management of Coastal Aquifers': Supported geophysical data collection, processing, and interpretation to improve coastal aquifer management.

'Analysis of aquifers in TESALIA properties': Aided in geophysical data collection and interpretation, emphasizing the estimation of underground water reserves.
profile_positions.title: Research Technician
